benchmark_details.name: CLEVA
benchmark_details.overview: CLEVA is a user-friendly platform designed to holistically evaluate Chinese Large Language Models (LLMs) across various dimensions. It employs a standardized workflow, mitigates contamination risks through data curation, and features a competitive leaderboard.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a comprehensive benchmark for evaluating Chinese LLMs based on diverse metrics and prompt evaluation.
tasks: Model evaluation across various NLP tasks
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: Performance may vary based on language models' ability to understand prompts.

data.source: Collected and curated through manual annotation and existing datasets.
data.size: 370K test instances from 84 datasets, resulting in over 9 million queries after augmentation.
data.annotation: Data includes a variety of prompts and is structured to ensure consistency in evaluation.

methods: Performance metrics based on diverse NLP tasks
Regular updates on testing to avoid contamination
methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on model predictions evaluated against reference outputs.
methodology.interpretation: Metrics provide insights into the model's performance, biases, and robustness against various evaluation criteria.
methodology.validation: Various validation methods including testing against known benchmarks and expert evaluations.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: Carefully managed with no sensitive information collected, with full informed consent from participants.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: All collected data is used responsibly and complies with relevant data protection regulations.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.consent_procedures: Participants were informed about data usage during the manual collection process.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.compliance_with_regulations: Followed ethical guidelines for data collection and testing.
